page.title: 07Farm visit - "Orrest Head"
page.content: This 500 acre farm is situated just to the east of Windermere and dates from the mid-17th century. On the farm there are 50 dairy cows, 20 beef cows, 20 beef calves, 30 milk heffers, 400 sheep, 4 sheep dogs, 1 terrier, 3 goats and 20 hens. They only sell their cows if they are old, lame or sick. They keep sheep for meat and only take wool off the older sheep. From the sheep they usually get 650 lambs - 325 will be breeding females and the rest will be sold for meat. They take their beef calves to Kendal market at 16 months old. In the spring of a typical year for the farmer, Mr. Willison, lambing takes place. Summer is hay making time and in the autumn he weans the lambs and sells them. In winter he repairs dry-stone walls, fences, drains and hedges.
